sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: Identify the products formed when magnesium metal reacts with hydrochloric acid (HCl) and write a balanced chemical equation for the reaction.
message_2:
When magnesium metal reacts with hydrochloric acid (HCl), the products formed are magnesium chloride (MgCl₂) and hydrogen gas (H₂). The balanced chemical equation for the reaction is:

Mg (s) + 2 HCl (aq) → MgCl₂ (aq) + H₂ (g)
